Having been neglected form a young age, Ming Lee was brought up by his troubled parents, till the home had found the perfect foster family for him - the Manickams. An amusing story of how a young boy is trying to fit in a peculiar family with different people with the added challenge of cultural and language differences.

programme.title: Oru Naal Koothu

programme.title: Oru Nodiyil
programme.desc: At the age of 4, Ravi was diagnosed with dyslexia. Realising that his son was dyslexic - his father's dreams for Ravi to become a radio DJ was shattered. His mother however became his pillar of strength. Ravi grew up being constantly criticised because of his learning disability and his struggles in school were beginning to weigh him down. Tired of the constant ridicules, Ravi decided to pursue his dreams, despite his challenges. Through his hard work and determination, he is now a well-known DJ.

programme.title: Oru Nodiyil
programme.desc: At the age of 19, Reshveen wanted to be a military officer and was ready to sign on when life took a drastic turn when he suffered a stroke. It made him loss his sensation on the left side of his body. He was not medically fit to serve as a soldier and was made a clerk in the army. In a desperation to do something else and better the situation he was in the teenage Reshveen along his friends, started a company with minimum knowledge about the business.More on this episode of Oru Nodiyil.
